column1: length just outside off, backs away and looks to punch through cover. Mistimed
swiped away. Kohli probably went Moeen expecting Warner to take strike. Turns out it's Bairstow's big stride that meets Mo. Outside off at a length, ends up past square leg and into the boundary
length outside off, steps out and taps through the open midwicket region
off we go. Length on off stump, too flat to cause issues for Warner who gets his front leg into the leg side and gently lofts this over extra cover
length and into the body, nudged in front of square leg with the angle

slapped behind square on the off side. More flat stuff, more skid off the pitch with no turn. Lots of width on this occasion too and for once, Bairstow gets ahead of Warner on the scoring. Deep into the crease and gratefully put away with a square cut
go fetch that! Warner was set 12 hours ago. Umesh bowls length in the corridor and the front leg is out of the way as he lifts it on the rise, straight and over the boundary
length outside off, sliced on the rise to point
length on middle stump, flicks across the angle and finds midwicket
slower ball, short of a length in the corridor. Forces him to check his shot - he wanted to punch that through cover. Extra cover falls to his right and gets a hand, but can't stop the single

length and a bit of wobble as this slants in to Bairstow. Everyone in world cricket knows that's the ball you bowl to him these days. Stands tall and punches to mid-on, albeit with a gap between bat and body
length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops this on the thigh
length and turning in at leg stump. Gets low and caresses this to deep midwicket's left with a closed face
finds square leg this time. Similar delivery, spinning in from a length. Check-sweep to the fielder
length at middle stump, ripping in at leg stump. Expertly pokes this into the vacant midwicket region with soft hands
length on leg stump, flicked with the turn to long-on's left
superb. A bit of a dance to make room. Chahal marginally short of a length outside off and Warner has done enough to free his arms and pummel him in front of point
length on leg stump, flicked with soft hands into the midwicket region
short of a length in the corridor, short-arm poke into the midwicket region
length ball slanted in at off stump, punched off the toe-end towards mid-on
slower ball at a length on leg stump, nudged through backward square
lobs it over square leg off the inside half. Length ball coming in and rising up. He swishes across the line and gets it into the boundary
uppish and into the third man boundary. Short and in the corridor. Gets up to cut and gets it off the thick outside edge
length outside off, looks to chop on the rise, can't beat Hetmyer's leap at backward point
leading edge safely past extra cover! Warner closes the face too early on this flick as the ball rises across him in the corridor
slower ball at a length on middle stump, watchfully clips this past short fine
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
bouncer down leg side, ducks under it

nicely put away and that's their third 50-plus stand in a row. Short and wide from Umesh. Point is in, third man is in. YJB bisects them perfectly. The only decision they have to make is who will go to retrieve it
length on middle stump, punched on the rise to long-on
yorker in the corridor, jams the bat down on it. Gets it to Hetmyer on the bounce at backward point
just evade mid-off. He has the runs, but he hasn't always been in control. Length outside off. goes on the rise and the bat turns in his hand as this slice clears Barman and runs away
in control this time! That's poor bowling. Short and very wide. Doesn't even bother keeping this cut shot down. Flies between backward point and cover
length in the corridor, hurriedly tapped into the covers
length on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
yorker length, tapped back down the pitch
floated up at a length outside off and turn into middle stump. Flicks to short fne's right
nice loopy length ball again. This one skids on as he flicks with soft hands to midwicket
length, flatter at middle stump. Steps out and pushes to long-on
short of a length and flat. Marginal turn in at the hips. Dropped into the leg side with soft hands
get out of the way Davey! No headbutts incoming, but he's nearly taken out Warner with this drive. Full on off and he bludgeons it to long-on, getting Warner hopping at the other end in the process
short of a length at off stump, pulled strategically between long-on and deep midwicket
length outside off, dragged to deep midwicket with a sweep on the up
length at the stumps, allows it to come on and drops it pitch side
pick-up, turn, throw. AB sprints to his left to retrieve a pull on the bounce at deep midwicket, and somehow manages to keep this to one. Dropped short from Chahal
length on leg stump, gently pushed to deep midwicket's right and they steal a second this time
length at middle stump, beats him in flight. Warner steps out and is forced to defend back towards the bowler
length at leg stump, stays in the crease and flicks to deep square
looks to reverse and can't get it past short third. Length in the corridor, has a whip at it, but it's a slow pace and once again he can't get it away
gorgeous! Lovely clean hit from a lovely clean blade. Bairstow reaches out at this length ball outside off, stands tall and pumps it over the extra cover boundary. Regal.

misfield from long-on after he makes the ground to his right. It's a full ball on middle stump, he plonks the front leg out and drives firmly against the turn. A tumble and a hand from the fielder, but not quite a stop

paddles it fine and brings up fifty! Second fiddle so far, but today he's taken the bowling on. And he's sized up the teenager. Gets low - the line is always going to be at the stumps - and exposes the stumps to pick his gap
length at leg stump, pushed through square leg off the back foot
length on leg stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
attempted slower ball is a full toss, lines up and punches it down to long-off
full slower ball at off stump, jammed down to long-off
buh-bye! That is...a filthy ball. Attempted slower one, dropped short and down leg side. Waits and waits and pumps it over the square leg boundary
third hundred stand in a row! Served up nicely again from CDG. Slower ball, short - he clubs from underneath and sends it way over long-on
inside edge to short fine. Length outside off, throws his hands at this but can't connect well enough
length on off stump, pushed through mid-off on the up
short ball, and he goes back and lofts this towards extra cover. They pick up two comfortably, and even think about a third. But they decide against it
short, and down the leg side and he swings this around to long leg. Will be disappointed that he only picks up one for this
short, and he swings this away towards deep midwicket, but it bounces ahead of the fielder there
full toss, and he goes down the ground. Just clears Hetmyer at long on! You can't miss your length to these two on this form
length ball, and he pats it towards midwicket and runs hard to pick up two. He goes to 49!
length ball, grips on the surface, and takes the leading edge as he looks to play this to the onside. No run for this
Yadav returns with a short ball, it's also slower through the air, and Bairstow hangs back and swings him around to long leg for four!
fuller, and he goes towards wide long on, and clears him comfortably! Sensational stuff from these two players!
short, and he moves away and swings this over the man at short midwicket. Wide long on gets across but cannot stop them from picking up two
short, and goes in towards him. Bairstow backs away, and leaves it. He hopes for this to be called wide, but it is just one short ball for the over

yorker! Perfectly done...straight and full. and he squeezes this off the inside towards the keeper. Parthiv Patel has a shy at the stumps but Bairstow is home. Wants to steal a single off the deflection, but the fielder at point converges on this quickly
full, outside off, and he creams this through covers. Stand and deliver!
fuller ball, and he drives this towards extra cover, and canters through for two. That's FIFTY for Warner!
sharp turn back into him from a length, some bounce too, and he goes back and cuts this towards backward point. Well bowled!
fired full, and down the leg side, but Bairstow looks for the reverse sweep. Not called wide, as he just misses out on contact
shimmies down the track and takes it on the full, and hammers this through midwicket for a FLAT SIX!
comes down the track and bunts a fuller ball towards long on
reverse hit attempted by Warner off a length ball. Gets it over short third man, but can only just clear him, and picks up two. Oh it's a cruel game sometimes, especially for the bowlers
short, and he goes back to cut this towards backward point
walks down to the leg side, and turns a ball that was aimed at his pads into a rank long hop outside off, and swings this ferociously over midwicket. SIX AGAIN!
flighted around his pads, and he pushes this towards long on. Played with just the right amount of weight to come back for two...easily!
makes room and thwacks a length ball tossed up on leg stump towards point
tossed up, outside off, and he lets this pass. Called wide as it goes past the tramlines
flighted, and he hammers this from outside off towards midwicket. That's 96 for Bairstow
flat and fast towards off stump, and he pushes this towards extra cover
flat ball towards the stumps, and he pushes this down to long on
goes back to a length ball, and pushes this with the turn away from him towards long off
short, and he goes back to dab this towards square leg, but hits it straight towards the man stationed next to the umpire
pulls out the reverse sweep to a fuller ball, and misses. Hits him outside the line
turns into him, and he goes back to cut this towards backward point. Will pick up a single to move to 99
fuller ball, and he tries to tuck this towards midwicket

length ball, and he skips down the wicket and plays this towards deep backward square leg. Back for the second, and that is HUNDRED for Bairstow. Skips up in the air to celebrate and then takes his helmet off. This has been a top-quality innings. Pedal to the metal from ball one, literally!
length ball, and he skips down and bunts this over midwicket. That's his sixth six, to go with 12 fours
outside off, and he looks to go towards midwicket, but gets an inside edge on towards long on
down the leg side, and it allows Warner to get down on one knee and swing this towards long leg
short, and he goes back and punches this towards extra cover
outside off, and he swings this across the line, but gets it over long on. Fantastic shot!
fired wide, and he cuts this fiercely, but the fielder at cover cuts this off and keeps it to one

a wicket at last! Tossed up, and Bairstow looks to go big over midwicket. Takes the leading edge and pops up, and Umesh Yadav takes a superb diving catch after running in from point. Bairstow gets a huge ovation as he walks off
fuller ball, and he goes down on one knee, and eases this several rows behind long on. What a way to get off the mark!
fuller, towards the leg stump, and he eases this towards deep midwicket. Wants two, but will have to settle for one
short, and he cuts this towards extra cover
full, down the leg side, and he sweeps. Gets it towards backward square leg, and because the fielder has some ground to cover, they come back for the second
full ball, and he digs it out, and Siraj is first to get to it. Has a shy at the stumps, but not close enough
full, but misses the yorker length. He makes room, and smashes this over long off!

Vijay Shankar could be out here! Warner gets a length ball, and he skews an attempted slog over the cover region. It falls in a vacant area, and Shankar wants a second, but as he is turned down for the second, he turns but the throw beats him. Sacrifices his wicket for the greater good
short ball, and he lets it pass hoping for this to be called. Siraj gets away with it though. Not high enough
full ball, and he squeezes it out. Gets it down to long leg, and a dive from Pathan helps him beat the throw from Moeen Ali
length ball, goes back into him with the angle, cramps him for room, and he can only get it down towards long off
short ball, outside off, and he biffs this towards midwicket, and it lands short of the man running in from the fence
full toss, and he gets this past short third man and point. Precise placement, and just using the pace of the ball
short, slow, and he picks this up, and drop-kicks this over long leg. What a way to move to 88 now! He definitely wants to get to that 100
full, outside off, and he drills this after making room. It's fielded by backward point, diving away to his left, but they take two easily
fuller ball, and he plays it towards midwicket, and they take two again
fuller ball, but he flicks this away towards midwicket, and retains strike for the last over
full ball, and he pushes it wide of long off, and will pick up two easily
full ball, at the stumps, but this time his push towards the covers travels quickly to deep extra cover. Just one run, as Warner rebukes himself for not having taken full toll
shorter, slower ball, and he somehow maneouvres this down towards fine leg. Brings Warner back on strike

that's 100 for Warner! Full toss, intended to be a yorker, and he walks away towards the leg side and creates some room for himself. Pushes this past short third man and point, and gets it towards backward point for four. Leaps into the air with joy, and then acknowledges all the fans around this stadium. What an innings! Welcome back, David Warner!
full ball, and he looks to play towards the onside, but it strikes his leg as he makes room. Will only get one for that
short ball, and he pushes this towards midwicket
length ball swung into the pads, looks to shovel it square, cops it on the pad
length at off stump, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine
length outside off, punches at it, thick edge down to third man
shot. Length ball just outside off, leans in and punches it between cover and extra
slower ball at a length outside off, uppishly flicked into the square leg region
short and wide outside off, cut straight to backward point
dropped short at off stump, backs into the leg side and slams this pull over midwicket.One bounce before finding the boundary
short outside off, cuts late to backward point's right. Yusuf throws at the non-striker's end but they've snuck through
length on leg stump, flicked straight to square leg
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket

finds extra cover. To the man who'd hit RCB's first IPL hundred. This is a full toss on off stump. He backs away and looks to slice it over the infield on the off side. It's a feeble lob to Pandey in the end
length in the corridor, looks to tuck it into the leg side and gets an inside edge onto his pads
length outside off, plants the front leg out and looks to drive on the rise through the off side. Gets it to mid-on off the inside half

it looks like a mis-hit but this has cleared the square leg boundary! Hetmyer loves this shot. Short of a length on middle stump, backs into the leg side and swipes this off the low part of the bat. It's gone 84 metres
full toss on off stump, flicked to midwicket's right
length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the outside half
length outside off, looks to drive through the off side, gets it to mid-on off the inside half

he's got him! Superb from Nabi who is now on a hat-trick! The perfect pace - slow, loopy, dipping and turning away from middle stump. This is how you find success in the Powerplay against a left-hander. Hetmyer running down the pitch, nowhere near the ball. Swings across the line and is stumped by a long way
length on middle stump, flicked to long-on's right
full outside off, whipped down to long-on
middle stump! AB is also done by the slow pace! Expects this to turn into him and go over the cover region, but this is straight past the outside edge. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball
full on off stump, driven with the turn to cover
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, walks down and looks to stab at it. Comes back down the pitch off the inside half
length outside off, punched to extra cover
length on leg stump, flicked to mid-on
slower ball at a length on middle stump, looks to flick and is beaten. Cops it on the body
slower ball at a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to short third
slower ball at a length on middle stump, flicked out to long-on
length outside off, looks to open up the off side to drive. Gets it off the low part of the bat to mid-off
missed stumping! Length ball skids in from outside off. He plays for the turn after stepping out, trying to drive into the off side. Beaten on the inside edge and Bairstow can't even get a hand on it
length on leg stump, flicked through midwicket off the back foot
length outside off, leans in, flicks uppishly into the leg side
short of a length in the corridor, punched to cover's left off the back foot
length outside off, backs away and toe-ends a punch to mid-off

straight to short extra! Sandeep Sharma has Kohli for the sixth time in the IPL in 42 balls! Overpitched ball just outisde off, backs away and drills this cover drive. Straigh to Warner. Didn't have to move

sloppy from Moeen and he is going to be out here. Royal Challengers completely blindsided here, they don't know what's hitting them. Slower ball at a length on leg stump, flicked towards midwicket. Mo wants the run, he's sent back. The fielder is off balance as he throws and therefore it comes in on the bounce. There's time for Moeen to get back in the crease but he merely plonks the bat in. He's short
slower short ball at leg stump, looks to pull and cops it on the body
shot. Short and wide outside off and some breathing space for RCB. Dube cashes in, cuts past point
short of a length outside off, looks to run it down to third man, under edge
slower ball at a length on middle stump, flicked to mid-on
length outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

drags it out to long-on! It's a free-for-all! Who wants to have a bowl? Length ball, some grip in the corridor. Looks to drill it straight over the bowler but he isn't to the pitch, so this comes off the inside half and is taken well inside the boundary
tossed up at a length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, pushed back down the pitch off the back foot
length outside off, driven to long-off
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
bouncer, dug in too short. Sways away from it
length at leg stump, flicked to fine leg with the angle
length at off stump, defended to extra cover off the back foot
length outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off
length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
goes back and punches a leg-break down to long off
turns into him, and he pushes this down towards long on with the turn
wrong 'un again, and he goes back and plays this towards fine leg
short ball, and he goes back and punches this towards deep midwicket
goes back and punches this towards point
wrong 'un, and he presses forward to defend this
short ball, and he swings this around, for six!
in the slot, and he slogs this towards midwicket. Manish Pandey makes a good stop
short ball, and he ducks under it as it passes through to the keeper
short, and he cuts this but cannot beat point
full ball, and he drops this down towards long on. Nearly carries to Vijay Shankar stationed there!
short, and he looks to hook this but misses out. Well directed, as he kept it outside off stump
short, and de Grandhomme swings this across over midwicket. Rank long-hop and he gives it the due treatment
turns away from him, and he plays from the crease as he looks to push this through the off side. Beaten outside the edge
turns into him, and he goes back and punches this towards midwicket
short, and he goes back and punches this towards backward point
plays it late with the turn, and plays it past point. Good shot!
good turn away from him, after pitching on a good length just outside off. Beats the outside edge again
length ball, and he goes back and punches this uppishly towards backward point
fuller ball, that moves into him, as he shapes to flick this. Gets it on to his pad and towards short fine leg
short ball, and he moves across to the off side and plays it down towards fine leg
length ball, straying down the pads, and Ray Barman gets some of his thigh pad on to this. Bairstow makes a terrific stop, diving away to his left
short ball, and he goes back and taps it towards short midwicket. Quick single taken
length ball, and he swings this towards the unprotected deep midwicket fence
length ball, wide outside off, and Ray Barman forces this away towards backward point
tossed up, and he goes inside out. Not far from the man at deep cover, but goes to the fence on one bounce
shorter in length, flatter, and straighter, and he goes back to punch this towards long on
length, and he goes back and punches this towards extra cover

chance missed at both ends! Tosses this up, and CdG gets the outside edge as he looks to swing this down the ground, and then it lands short of point, who has a shy at the non-striker's end, but Rashid cannot collect
great ball! Jags away after pitching on a length just outside off. Beats the outside edge, and also misses the off stump by a whisker
length ball, outside off, and he misses out as he tries to run this down towards third man. 133.9kph
length ball, outside off, and he looks to push this towards covers, and misses for the second time in a row
short ball, and he gets behind the line and swings this away towards long leg. Top shot!
fuller ball, and he looks to drive down the ground, but gets it too straight to Kaul, who dives away to his right to stop this
full ball, just outside off, and he misses out on contact as he looks to run this down towards third man
length ball, comes back into him off the seam, and he pushes this towards cover and picks up one
slower ball, just outside off, and he looks to chip it down the ground. Checks the shot, and it loops up towards short midwicket. Ray Barman's resistance comes to an end
fuller ball, but going down the leg side, as Umesh shapes to defend. Beats the inside edge and hits his pad
slower ball, that angles across him to the off side, and he pushes it towards cover
short ball, outside off, and he swings this away towards midwicket. Some good running allows him to come back for the second
slower ball, and he has got a good hold of this. Was in no great shape, but gave it a right ol' humpty! Sails over midwicket
short again, and he plays this towards long leg
fuller ball, and he drives it hard, but only gets it mid off
SHOT! Pitched up, and gives him some width outside off, and he drives it hard past extra cover

short, and he looks to swing this around. Called wide, but SRH have reviewed this for a caught-behind. Yadav was looking to move across and get this down towards fine leg, and Bairstow collected. From the first look, it looks like it might have taken a bit of the thigh pad. Will have to take this back and call it a dot ball
will have to rebowl this. Down the leg side, and called wide
fuller ball, and he looks to go hard down the ground. Gets the inner part of the bat, out towards long leg
full toss, outside off, and CdG has an almighty swipe at it, but misses out on contact
takes this on the full and drives it down the ground. Comfortable stop for long off
tossed up, outside off, and he drives it hard back towards the bowler
sharp turn just outside off, and it breaks away from him as he shapes to push it towards long off. Beaten again

tossed up outside off, and he pushes this towards backward point. They want to push for two, but the return is sharp and straight to Rashid. Easy run-out of Umesh Yadav, who was very slow during the first. Terrible running!
pushes a length ball towards extra cover
tossed up, and he looks to drive this. Inside edge on to his leg, and it drops outside off
length ball, and he goes back to defend this as it turns away from him
fuller ball, and he gets this away with a slightly angled bat towards midwicket. Will pick up two for this
full, and wide, and just within the tramlines, de Grandhomme has a go, but misses out
full toss, and he goes inside out. Bhuvneshwar Kumar lets this one slip through his hands, fielding at cover
fuller ball, but down the leg side. Will have to have a go again at this

one of the two players is run out! It was played towards covers, and the fielder fired a quick return back to the bowler. He whips the bails off, and CdG's bat is in the air! He also got rid of Siraj at the other end, but sadly only one of those will count. Sums up RCB's evening, though. Nothing has gone right from the first ball itself this afternoon
full, outside off, and he swings and he misses. Was looking to hit this into Guntur!
full ball, and he drives this wide of long off
full ball, and Chahal drives this back on the bounce to the bowler
taps a length ball towards extra cover
fuller ball, on the stumps, and he whips this away towards deep midwicket
short ball, angles away from him, and he leaves this alone
short ball, and he pulls this towards deep midwicket. Nabi runs in, and gets to it, but cannot hold on as he falls. Looks a little bothered by that, but hopefully his fingers are fine
slower ball, and he has launched this into the air, and Deepak Hooda gets under this one. That's that!
